issue.title: `color_letter` function is buggy
issue.body:
color_letter function in ConsoleInteraction module does not work as expected when there is an upper case letter after "the" upper case letter.
e.g. If line is Edit (C)ommit Message then output is Edit (M)ommit Message

issue.title: Running "coala --json --show-bears --show-details" is raising errors
issue.body:
Build error:
NotImplementedError: This platform doesn't have any of the specified package manager(s): brew
OS System: Linux

issue.title: setup.py fails on old setuptools, etc.
issue.body:
python setup.py install
+tee setup.log
error in coala setup command: 'tests_require' must be a string or list of strings containing valid project/version requirement specifiers; Expected ',' or end-of-list in moban~=0.3.3 ; python_version > '3.0' at  ; python_version > '3.0'

https://travis-ci.org/coala/coala/jobs/533336623

issue.title: [BUG] An unknown error occurred
issue.body:

Kernel: 5.0.17-300.fc30.x86_64
Command Run
$ coala --show-bears --filter-by language Java --show-details --json

Console Output
[WARNING][13:56:33] show_description parameter is deprecated
[WARNING][13:56:33] show_params parameter is deprecated
[ERROR][13:56:33] An unknown error occurred. This is a bug. We are sorry for the inconvenience. Please contact the developers for assistance. During execution of coala an exception was raised. This should never happen. When asked for, the following information may help investigating:
[INFO][13:56:33] Exception was:
Traceback (most recent call last):

  File "/home/amol/GitHub/coala/coalib/coala.py", line 87, in main
    args)

  File "/home/amol/GitHub/coala/coalib/output/ConsoleInteraction.py", line 1010, in show_bears
    print_bears(bears, show_description, show_params, console_printer, args)

  File "/home/amol/GitHub/coala/coalib/output/ConsoleInteraction.py", line 971, in print_bears
    separators=(',', ': '))

  File "/home/amol/anaconda3/envs/coala/lib/python3.7/json/__init__.py", line 238, in dumps
    **kw).encode(obj)

  File "/home/amol/anaconda3/envs/coala/lib/python3.7/json/encoder.py", line 201, in encode
    chunks = list(chunks)

  File "/home/amol/anaconda3/envs/coala/lib/python3.7/json/encoder.py", line 431, in _iterencode
    yield from _iterencode_dict(o, _current_indent_level)

  File "/home/amol/anaconda3/envs/coala/lib/python3.7/json/encoder.py", line 405, in _iterencode_dict
    yield from chunks

  File "/home/amol/anaconda3/envs/coala/lib/python3.7/json/encoder.py", line 325, in _iterencode_list
    yield from chunks

  File "/home/amol/anaconda3/envs/coala/lib/python3.7/json/encoder.py", line 439, in _iterencode
    yield from _iterencode(o, _current_indent_level)

  File "/home/amol/anaconda3/envs/coala/lib/python3.7/json/encoder.py", line 431, in _iterencode
    yield from _iterencode_dict(o, _current_indent_level)

  File "/home/amol/anaconda3/envs/coala/lib/python3.7/json/encoder.py", line 405, in _iterencode_dict
    yield from chunks

  File "/home/amol/anaconda3/envs/coala/lib/python3.7/json/encoder.py", line 439, in _iterencode
    yield from _iterencode(o, _current_indent_level)

  File "/home/amol/anaconda3/envs/coala/lib/python3.7/json/encoder.py", line 429, in _iterencode
    yield from _iterencode_list(o, _current_indent_level)

  File "/home/amol/anaconda3/envs/coala/lib/python3.7/json/encoder.py", line 325, in _iterencode_list
    yield from chunks

  File "/home/amol/anaconda3/envs/coala/lib/python3.7/json/encoder.py", line 438, in _iterencode
    o = _default(o)

  File "/home/amol/GitHub/coala/coalib/output/JSONEncoder.py", line 32, in default
    for member in get_public_members(obj)}

  File "/home/amol/anaconda3/envs/coala/lib/python3.7/site-packages/coala_utils/decorators.py", line 135, in get_public_members
    return {attr: getattr(obj, attr) for attr in dir(obj)

  File "/home/amol/anaconda3/envs/coala/lib/python3.7/site-packages/coala_utils/decorators.py", line 137, in <dictcomp>
    and not hasattr(getattr(obj, attr), '__call__')}

  File "/home/amol/.local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/dependency_management/requirements/DistributionRequirement.py", line 205, in package_managers
    self.get_package_managers())

  File "/home/amol/.local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/dependency_management/requirements/DistributionRequirement.py", line 193, in get_package_managers
    '{}'.format(','.join(self.packages.keys())))

NotImplementedError: This platform doesn't have any of the specified package manager(s): apt_get

--json argument was not built to handle a command like this, should show proper error message than a raw exception
difficulty/medium+

issue.title: [BUG] --filter-by wrong section name throws exception
issue.body:
Command Run
$ coala --json --filter-by some_unknown_filter_that_doesnt_exist

Output
[ERROR][14:47:33] An unknown error occurred. This is a bug. We are sorry for the inconvenience. Please contact the developers for assistance. During execution of coala an exception was raised. This should never happen. When asked for, the following information may help investigating:
[INFO][14:47:33] Exception was:
Traceback (most recent call last):

  File "/home/amol/GitHub/coala/coalib/coala_main.py", line 170, in run_coala
    filtered = apply_filters(filters, sections=all_sections)

  File "/home/amol/GitHub/coala/coalib/parsing/FilterHelper.py", line 81, in apply_filters
    items = applier(filter_name, filter_args, items)

  File "/home/amol/GitHub/coala/coalib/parsing/FilterHelper.py", line 101, in _apply_section_filter
    raise InvalidFilterException(filter_name)

coalib.parsing.InvalidFilterException.InvalidFilterException: 'some_unknown_filter_that_doesnt_exist' is an invalid filter. Available filters: can_detect, can_fix, language, section_tags


During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:


Traceback (most recent call last):

  File "/home/amol/GitHub/coala/coalib/coala_main.py", line 174, in run_coala
    console_printer.print(ex)

AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'print'

{
  "results": {}
}

Possible Solution
The proper error message must be shown indicating such a filter doesn't exist instead of throwing a raw error message.
InvalidFilterException exception is being correctly emitted by the bear, just need to catch it and show an error message.
difficulty/low

issue.title: Asyncio.py incompatible with Python 3.7
issue.body:
#5891 introduced this file from an external repository, as it has a useful chunk of code, but it also includes code which is incompatible with Python 3.7
Line 14: from·asyncio·import·async
Also on lower versions of python it triggers pycodestyle warning: W606 'async' and 'await' are reserved keywords starting with Python 3.7
Ideally we enhance moban to somehow deal with this, where we want a subset of a file from an external source.
Another alternative is to move this chunk of code into a separate package, which we only need for older versions of Python, and in the separate repo/package the history/attribution/copyright of the chunk of code can be shown clearly.

issue.title: coala_main.py and other files exceed line length according to PEP8 standard
issue.body:
coala_main.py, coalib/core/Core.py, setup.py, and some other files exceed the line length limit according to PEP8 standard.
Some of them can possibly be solved by adjusting the imports and docstrings.

issue.title: Setting.py: Change property name
issue.body:
The line_number property for Setting class should be changed to start_line_number as it is the starting line number of a setting.
difficulty/newcomer

issue.title: Appveyor build fails
issue.body:
Appveyor build is failing due to the recent changes in coalib\misc\Asyncio.py in the commit 58b9f41 . It is due QuotesBear.
The build report is here
The snippet of error:
Executing section python...
**** QuotesBear [Section <empty> | Severity NORMAL] ****
!    ! You do not use the preferred quotation marks. Preferred mark: '
[----] c:\projects\coala\coalib\misc\Asyncio.py
[++++] c:\projects\coala\coalib\misc\Asyncio.py
[   1] """Asyncio backports for Python 3.4.3 compatibility."""
[   1] '""Asyncio backports for Python 3.4.3 compatibility.""'

area/ci difficulty/newcomer

issue.title: LocalBearTestHelper.execute_bear: Remove final return statement
issue.body:
There is a yield in line 47 and a return in line 54. As long as the try block doesn't encounter an error, both are reached.
Sonarcube counts this as a breaking bug.
